Hi all,

I thought the following might be of interest to some of you. 

We =
recently presented a paper at the IEEE Computational Intelligence
and Games=
 2008 symposium where NEAT and rtNEAT are used to dynamically
adjust the ch=
allenge level of a real-time strategy game.

Here is the article:
http://ww=
w.itu.dk/~yannakakis/cig08_1.pdf

In a few words, NEAT worked just fine in =
generating diverse NPC
behaviors like 'win-fast' and 'produce-maximum-numbe=
rs-of-warriors'.
rtNEAT, on the other hand did not perform that well and th=
at fast due
to insufficient interaction in the RTS game under investigation=
. 

Comments and feedback are more than welcome.

Regards
Georgios
